title: Labor critic wants Shorten to stick around
text:
One of Labor's most outspoken internal critics has welcomed Bill Shorten's decision to stick around in federal politics.

Joel Fitzgibbon was scathing of his party's policy platform in the days and weeks after its shock loss at the election in May.

Even so, he is happy the man who led Labor to defeat has flagged his intention to stay on.

"I think it's a great credit to Bill Shorten that he's taken responsibility for the loss and I'm pleased that he's determined to remain part of the Labor team," Mr Fitzgibbon told the Nine Network on Monday.

"He's too experienced and too talented to let go."
